meanings.definition: A person who holds a title or position.
meanings.sent1: The titler of the company was responsible for making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The titler of the school was the principal.
meanings.sent3: The titler of the chess club always wore a crown to meetings.
meanings.sent4: She was the titler of the dance floor, ruling it with her graceful moves.
meanings.sent5: The titler of the team led them to victory with strategic planning.

meanings.definition: A tool used for titling or labeling.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a titler to mark the students' assignments.
meanings.sent2: The titler helped organize the files by labeling them clearly.
meanings.sent3: The titler beeped happily each time a label was printed.
meanings.sent4: The titler worked tirelessly, ensuring every item was properly labeled.
meanings.sent5: With the titler, the librarian could easily categorize the books.

meanings.definition: To give a title to something.
meanings.sent1: She would titler each chapter of her book before writing it.
meanings.sent2: The author decided to titler the novel 'The Secret Garden'.
meanings.sent3: He would titler his pet cat with a different title every day.
meanings.sent4: The chef would titler each dish on the menu with care.
meanings.sent5: The artist would titler each painting based on its inspiration.
